item.title: By: Finster
item.dc:creator: Finster
item.description: You mean powergaming isn't a rich full life? Your words are scary and confusing.
item.content:encoded: You mean powergaming isn’t a rich full life? Your words are scary and confusing.

item.title: By: mythago
item.dc:creator: mythago
item.description: It all becomes clear when you realize these people define "rich and full life" as "one where all spare time is spent powergaming."
item.content:encoded: It all becomes clear when you realize these people define “rich and full life” as “one where all spare time is spent powergaming.”

item.title: By: Ethic
item.dc:creator: Ethic
item.description:
I have the job, the wife, the 2 kids. At the end of the day I have 2 or 3 hours for gaming, provided I don't want to do anything else. Such as: surf the web, read a book, watch TV, go for a walk, etc. The gaming is always the lowest priority, yet I spend way too much time thinking about playing when I can't. I feel like I have a full and rewarding life.
My brother is on the other end of the spectrum. He puts in over 240 hours of gaming every month. That is roughly 8 hours a day. He has a job, but no wife and no kids. Sleep, work, game. Is that a full life? Not in my world.
